article.title: Boötes-HiZELS: an optical to near-infrared survey of emission-line galaxies at $\bf z=0.4-4.7$

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following emission-line pairs does NOT have matched volume coverage in the Boötes-HiZELS survey?
In the NB921 excess diagram, which type of line-emitters are typically identified at the faintest magnitudes and have the highest observed equivalent widths?
According to the right panel, what is the approximate fraction of classed [Oii] emitters at line fluxes below 6.3 × 10−17 erg s−1 cm−2 in NB921?
The power-law like behaviour of the Lyα luminosity function at the bright end is primarily attributed to what?
choices: A combination of Type I & II AGN

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main reason for the luminosity offset observed between the Hα luminosity functions measured in this work and those from Sobral et al. (2013) at z = 1.47?
choices: Different aperture sizes used for photometry

multiple_choice_question.text: The number densities of [Oii] emitters at z = 3.3 and z = 4.7 are slightly higher than those observed by Khostovan et al. (2015). What is the most likely explanation for this discrepancy?
What is the observed change in the median [Oii]/Hα ratio between z = 0.1 and z = 1.47?
At which Hα luminosity does the X-ray fraction of HAEs start to significantly increase?
According to formula (1), how is the flux density (f_i) related to the AB magnitude (m_i)?
choices: f_i is directly proportional to m_i
f_i is inversely proportional to m_i
f_i is exponentially related to m_i
f_i is logarithmically related to m_i
